item.title: Conduent confirms outage was due to a cybersecurity incident
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
U.S. government contractor Conduent, which provides technology to support services such as child support and food assistance, has confirmed that a recent outage was caused by a cybersecurity incident.  Conduent confirmed the disruption, which left some U.S. residents without access to support payments, to TechCrunch on Tuesday but declined to say whether the outage was […]

item.title: AI apps saw over $1 billion in consumer spending in 2024
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Demand for generative AI help drive consumer spending on apps to $150 billion globally in 2024, up 13% from the prior year. According to an annual “State of Mobile” report from app intelligence provider Sensor Tower (which acquired Data.ai, the original report’s author, last March), AI apps saw a surge of interest over the past […]

item.title: Trump open to Elon Musk or Larry Ellison buying TikTok
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
President Donald Trump has said he would be open to Tesla CEO Elon Musk or Oracle chairman Larry Ellison buying TikTok as part of join venture with the U.S. government. Trump was asked at a press conference on Tuesday if he was open to “Elon buying TikTok.” He responded that he would be, and added: […]

item.title: Databricks closes $15.3B financing at $62B valuation, Meta joins as ‘strategic investor’
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Data analytics platform Databricks has confirmed that it has closed a previously announced $10 billion in Series J equity financing at a $62 billion valuation. The San Francisco-based company also added a further $5.25 billion in debt financing, funded by JPMorgan Chase, Barclays, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, among other “leading financial institutions and alternative […]

item.title: What PowerSchool isn’t saying about its ‘massive’ student data breach
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The hack has the potential to be one of the biggest of the year, but the edtech giant is refusing to answer important questions

item.title: Ramp encroaches into digital bank territory with new treasury product
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
Over the years, Ramp has built a name for itself in the corporate card and expense management space. It’s branched out into travel, bill pay, and more, while raising over $1.2 billion in venture funding. Today, the six-year-old fintech startup is announcing a different kind of expansion — one that takes it into more of […]

item.title: Postman launches an AI agent builder on top of its API platform
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Since it was founded in 2014, India-based Postman has made a name for itself as one of the most popular platforms for building and using APIs, with 500,000 organizations now using the service. Like with so many other SaaS services, though, its valuation today is reportedly down from its $5.6 billion high in 2021. But […]

item.title: Sales knowledge automation platform 1up gets a third of its customer leads from memes
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
When George Avetisov was the founder and CEO of cybersecurity startup HYPR, he spent a lot of time in the trenches with the company’s sales team. He quickly realized that regardless of how good his sales team was, they were consistently pulling in other departments to answer customer questions or fill out technical questionnaires. “They […]

item.title: Doti gives enterprises a flexible AI-powered search experience to unlock their data silos
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
As enterprises look at how they can best leverage AI to increase their employees’ productivity, search is an obvious use case. In most companies, after all, data lives in multiple disconnected silos and the combination of large language models, retrieval augmented generation (RAG) and enterprise-grade integration services now makes it easier than ever to not […]

item.title: Lindus Health raises $55M to ‘fix the broken clinical trial industry’
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
A four-year-old London startup backed by Peter Thiel has raised a $55 million Series B round as it sets about “fixing the broken clinical trial industry.” The announcement comes as artificial intelligence is shaping up to revolutionize drug discovery and development, in turn spurring demand for a streamlined clinical trial process to help get new […]

item.title: Google hit with $12.6M fine in Indonesia for monopolistic practices in payment system
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
Indonesia’s antitrust agency KPPU fined Google 202.5 billion Rupiahs, equivalent to $12.6 million, on Wednesday for antitrust violation related to its payment system services for the Google Play Store. The KPPU ordered the search giant to cease the mandatory use of Google Play Billing in the Google Play Store. It also asked Google to let […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Hindustan Unilever to acquire Peak XV-backed Minimalist for over $340M
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Hindustan Unilever has agreed to acquire beauty startup Minimalist for about $342 million, as the consumer goods giant seeks to expand in India’s fast-growing premium skincare market. Hindustan Unilever will initially acquire a 90.5% stake in the direct-to-consumer brand through secondary buyouts and primary investment, with the remaining 9.5% to be purchased from founders in […]

item.title: UK appoints ex-Amazon executive Doug Gurr as interim chair of antitrust body
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
The U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has a new interim chairman: former Amazon executive Doug Gurr (pictured above). The announcement comes as the U.K. seeks to position itself as a pro-growth, pro-tech nation by cutting red-tape and bureaucracy, with artificial intelligence (AI) taking center stage. The country is also nearing the end of a […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Indian fintech Jar turns cash flow positive
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Indian fintech Jar has turned cash flow positive, an executive at the Tiger Global-backed startup confirmed on Wednesday. The three-year-old startup, which offers savings and investment services to consumers, achieved the milestone while still growing by more than 10 times last year, according to an investor note seen by TechCrunch. The profitability push comes as […]

item.title: Vertice bags $50M for its AI-powered SaaS spend platform
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
Vertice has made a name for itself over the years in the crowded world of expenditure management by focusing on applying AI to optimize an area where businesses are sinking hundreds of billions of dollars annually: software and cloud spend. The London-based startup’s business has grown 13x in the three years since its inception (similar […]

item.title: Truecaller brings real-time caller ID to iPhone users
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh, Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Truecaller for iOS has been updated with live caller ID support for its premium iPhone users.

item.title: Trump pardons Silk Road creator Ross Ulbricht
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
President Trump on Tuesday pardoned Ross Ulbricht, the creator of the infamous dark web exchange Silk Road, which was best known as a once-thriving online marketplace for illegal drugs. Trump announced the news in a Truth Social post, saying the pardon was in honor of Ulbricht’s mother and the Libertarian movement. In 2015, a federal […]

item.title: MrBeast is reportedly now among those trying to buy TikTok
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
An unlikely group, including Mr Beast and Bench acquirer Employer.com, has submitted a bid to buy TikTok.

item.title: Former Meta COO Sheryl Sandberg sanctioned by judge for allegedly deleting emails
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
A Delaware judge has sanctioned Sheryl Sandberg, Meta’s former COO and board member, for allegedly deleting emails related to the Cambridge Analytica privacy scandal. The decision arises from a case Meta shareholders brought against Sandberg and another former Meta board member, Jeff Zients, late last year. The plaintiffs alleged that Sandberg and Zients used personal […]

item.title: Microsoft is no longer OpenAI’s exclusive cloud provider
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Microsoft was once the exclusive provider of data center infrastructure for OpenAI to train and run its AI models. No longer. Coinciding with the announcement of Stargate, OpenAI’s massive new AI infrastructure deal with SoftBank, Oracle, and others, Microsoft says it has signed a new agreement with OpenAI that gives it “right of first refusal” […]
